title: Funerary epitaph for P. Alfesius Salvus
support: Rectangular grey plaque, very well squared, all sides original. Rear is flat. Traces of modern red paint. There is a thin horizontal crack in the upper part of the stone.

layout.p: Four lines of Latin text. First two lines are roughly centred, but final two are right-aligned on stone leaving a large vacat on left.

handNote.lettering: Carving of letters is rough, getting rougher and more inconsistent. Text is angular and haphazard, more pronounced in line 4. Letter heights and depths are inconsistent. Use of serifs and the apex on the 'A' in line 4 is particularly pronounced. Triangular interpuncts of different shapes: lines 1-2, interpuncts are outline triangles, line 4, interpuncts are hollowed out.

date._: Bivona attributed to C1 BCE on palaeographic grounds, but it could also be slightly later

provenanceFound._: Found in Termini Imerese outside the porta di Caccamo (= Porta di Girgenti), in a burial ground.

provenanceObserved._: Antoniou, 2023-07-05. In the Depositi of Museo Civico Baldassare Romano, room 1, scaffold 8, shelf 6.

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2023-07-05.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana; photo J. Prag 2023-07-05.

museum.name: Museo Civico Baldassare Romano
museum.description: A large and well-displayed collection. It begins with three ante-rooms, in the first of which is a rich display of lithics (mainly Neolithic) from the surrounding area. A display of material from Himera (lion-head spouts from the Temple of Victory and red-figure craters being the principle pieces) and a numismatic gallery then follow before the main room which contains Hellenistic and Roman material from Termini Imerese itself. Small finds, sculpture and inscriptions predominate. The museum collection continues upstairs with non-archaeological material (and a single inscription). The courtyard of the building holds a large collection of architectural pieces and inscriptions

location.address: Via Marco Tullio Cicerone, 90018 - Termini Imerese (PA)

bibl.title: Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese
bibl.citation: Livia Bivona, Iscrizioni latine lapidarie del museo civico di Termini Imerese, vol. 9/8, Kokalos Supplementi / Sikelika serie storica (Palermo / Rome, 1994)
